paper_abstract: A c-interval is the disjoint union of c intervals over N. The C-INTERVAL MULTICOVER problem is the special case of SET MULTICOVER where all sets available for covering are c-intervals. We strengthen known APX-hardness results for C-INTERVAL MULTICOVER, show W[1]-hardness when parameterized by the solution size, and present fixed-parameter algorithms for alternative parameterizations. (C) 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Approximability and parameterized complexity of multicover by c-intervals
